posts.content:
github.com




GitHub - ritwiktrivedi/ROE-Master-Snippets-File
Contribute to ritwiktrivedi/ROE-Master-Snippets-File development by creating an account on GitHub.






This is a repo some of us have been working on. It not complete but we are getting there. PRs are appreciated.
Thanks to the course team for giving us this idea of having snippets for common operations.

posts.content: I am too sleepy to work on it now… So seriously… PRs are not only appreciated but needed. Just add the basic parsing code or image manipulation for ga5. I will try and add in the morning but who doesn’t like Good PRs? Also mentioning @23f2005325 (Aishik) here for his wonderful PR which I have now merged.

hi, thanks to you and the other contributors for the effort
i have added llm week-3 codes through pull request. my code my not be perfect. but when I ran it in my laptop, it worked fine. pls do verify once before ROE

posts.image_description:
Here's a concise description of the image:

The image depicts a Source Control Graph, showcasing a Git history within a development environment, likely Visual Studio Code given the style. The "main" branch is highlighted, indicating the currently active branch. The history includes merge requests (#2, #3, and #1), commits related to adding "chardet code," renaming a README file, and work related to "llm code week-3". Other commits detail tasks like adding a link to a website and introducing Nominatim API samples. The colored dots and lines visually represent the branching and merging of code, reflecting the flow of changes within the repository. This helps developers understand the evolution of their codebase.

posts.content: Failure is part of life. My laptop hanged and despite having all the needed resources I panicked and the exam went the way it went. I take this as a lesson. This resource will be refined further. I thank everyone involved. I am glad that many benefitted and were actually able to score well.
